t: Isaiah 65
The Lord’s Response
“I*pn was sought by those who did not ask; I*ln was found by those who did not seek me. I*ln said, ‘Here I am, here I am,’ to*ln a nation that did not call on my name.
I*ln spread out my hands all day long to*ln a rebellious people who*ln walk in the path that is not good, following*ln their own thoughts.
These*ln people continually anger me to*ln my face, sacrificing*ln in gardens, burning*ln incense on bricks,
sitting*ln among the graves, spending*ln nights in secret places, eating*ln the meat of pigs, and*ln putting polluted broth in their bowls.
They*ln say, ‘Keep to yourself, don’t*ln come near me, for I am too holy for you!’ These*ln practices are smoke in my nostrils, a*ln fire that burns all day long.
Look,*ln it is written in front of me: I*ln will not keep silent, but I will repay; I*ln will repay them fully

for*ln your iniquities and the iniquities of*ln your ancestors together,” says*ln the Lord.*s “Because*ln they burned incense on the mountains and*ln reproached me on the hills, I*ln will reward them fully for*ln their former deeds.”

The*p Lord*s says this: “As*pn the new wine is found in a bunch of grapes, and*ln one says, ‘Don’t destroy it, for*ln there’s some good in it,’ so*ln I will act because of my servants and*ln not destroy them all.
I*ln will produce descendants from Jacob, and*ln heirs to my mountains from Judah; my*ln chosen ones will possess it, and*ln my servants will dwell there.
Sharon*ln will be a pasture for flocks, and*ln the Valley of Achor a place for herds to lie down, for*ln my people who have sought me.
But*ln you who abandon the Lord,*s who*ln forget my holy mountain, who*ln prepare a table for Fortune and*ln fill bowls of mixed wine for Destiny,

I*ln will destine you for the sword, and*ln all of you will kneel down to be slaughtered, because*ln I called and you did not answer, I*ln spoke and you did not hear; you*ln did what was evil in my sight and*ln chose what I did not delight in.”

Therefore,*p this is what the Lord God*s says: “Look!*pn My servants will eat, but*ln you will be hungry. Look!*ln My servants will drink, but*ln you will be thirsty. Look!*ln My servants will rejoice, but*ln you will be put to shame.
Look!*ln My servants will shout for joy from a glad heart, but*ln you will cry out from an anguished heart, and*ln you will lament out of a broken spirit.
You*ln will leave your name behind as*ln a curse for my chosen ones, and*ln the Lord God*s will kill you; but*ln he will give his servants another name.

Whoever*ln asks for a blessing in the land will*ln ask for a blessing by the God of truth, and*ln whoever swears in the land will*ln swear by the God of truth. For*ln the former troubles will be forgotten and*ln hidden from my sight.
A New Creation
“For*pn I will create new heavens and a new earth; the*ln past events will not be remembered or come to mind.
Then*ln be glad and rejoice forever in*ln what I am creating; for*ln I will create Jerusalem to be a joy and*ln its people to be a delight.
I*ln will rejoice in Jerusalem and*ln be glad in my people. The*ln sound of weeping and crying will*ln no longer be heard in her.

In*ln her, a nursing infant will no longer live only*ln a few days, or*ln an old man not live out his days. Indeed,*ln the one who dies at a hundred years old will*ln be mourned as a young man, and*ln the one who misses a hundred years will*ln be considered cursed.
People*ln will build houses and live in them; they*ln will plant vineyards and eat their fruit.

They*ln will not build and others live in them; they*ln will not plant and others eat. For*ln my people’s lives will be like*ln the lifetime of a tree. My*ln chosen ones will fully enjoy the*ln work of their hands.
They*ln will not labor without success or*ln bear children destined for disaster, for*ln they will be a people blessed by the Lord*s along*ln with their descendants.
Even*ln before they call, I will answer; while*ln they are still speaking, I will hear.

The*ln wolf and the lamb will feed together, and*ln the lion will eat straw like cattle, but*ln the serpent’s food will be dust! They*ln will not do what is evil or destroy on*ln my entire holy mountain,” says*ln the Lord.*s
